018package org.opengis.metadata.content;
019
020import java.util.ArrayList;
021import java.util.Map;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.Collections;
024import java.util.Locale;
025import java.nio.charset.Charset;
026import org.opengis.metadata.citation.Citation;
027import org.opengis.util.GenericName;
028import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
029
030import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.*;
031import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.*;
032
033
034/**
035 * Information identifying the feature catalogue or the conceptual schema.
036 *
037 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (IRD)
038 * @version 3.1
039 * @since   2.0
040 */
041@UML(identifier="MD_FeatureCatalogueDescription", specification=ISO_19115)
042public interface FeatureCatalogueDescription extends ContentInformation {
043    /**
044     * Indication of whether or not the cited feature catalogue complies with ISO 19110.
045     * This value is optional, and therefore may be null.
046     *
047     * @return whether or not the cited feature catalogue complies with ISO 19110, or {@code null}.
048     */
049    @UML(identifier="complianceCode", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
050    default Boolean isCompliant() {
051        return null;
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * Language(s) and character set(s) used within the catalogue.
056     * Note that contrarily to the {@code PT_Locale} object defined by ISO 19115:2014, the {@code java.util.Locale}
057     * object does not contain character encoding information. The character set information is stored in separated
058     * objects, associated to locales through entries in the map.
059     *
060     * <h4>XML representation</h4>
061     * XML documents shall format languages using the ISO 639-2 language code as returned by {@link Locale#getISO3Language()}.
062     * Character sets shall be referenced by name from the IANA Character Set register.
063     *
064     * @departure integration
065     *   GeoAPI replaces ISO 19115:2014 {@code LanguageCode}, {@code CountryCode} and {@code MD_CharacterSetCode}
066     *   code lists by equivalent objects from the standard Java library.
067     *   See {@link org.opengis.metadata.Metadata#getLocalesAndCharsets()} for more information.
068     *
069     * @return language(s) and character set(s) used within the catalogue.
070     *
071     * @see org.opengis.metadata.identification.DataIdentification#getLocalesAndCharsets()
072     * @see org.opengis.metadata.Metadata#getLocalesAndCharsets()
073     *
074     * @since 3.1
075     */
076    @UML(identifier="locale", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
077    default Map<Locale,Charset> getLocalesAndCharsets() {
078        return Collections.emptyMap();
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Language(s) used within the catalogue.
083     *
084     * @return language(s) used within the catalogue.
085     *
086     * @deprecated Replaced by {@code getLocalesAndCharsets().keySet()}.
087     */
088    @Deprecated(since="3.1")
089    @UML(identifier="language", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19115, version=2003)
090    default Collection<Locale> getLanguages() {
091        return getLocalesAndCharsets().keySet();
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Indication of whether or not the feature catalogue is included with the resource.
096     *
097     * @return whether or not the feature catalogue is included with the resource.
098     */
099    @UML(identifier="includedWithDataset", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
100    default boolean isIncludedWithDataset() {
101        return false;
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Subset of feature types from cited feature catalogue occurring in resource
106     * and count of feature instances.
107     *
108     * @return subset of feature types occurring in resource.
109     *
110     * @departure rename
111     *   Renamed from "{@code featureTypes}" to "{@code featureTypeInfo}" for the following reasons:
112     *   <ol>
113     *     <li>Avoid name collision with the ISO 19115:2003 definition of "{@code featureTypes}".</li>
114     *     <li>Avoid confusion between {@code FeatureTypeInfo} and {@code org.opengis.feature.FeatureType}.
115     *         A {@code getFeatureTypes()} method name would suggest that the collection contains the latter.</li>
116     *   </ol>
117     *
118     * @since 3.1
119     */
120    @UML(identifier="featureTypes", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
121    default Collection<? extends FeatureTypeInfo> getFeatureTypeInfo() {
122        return Collections.emptyList();
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * Names of the {@linkplain #getFeatureTypes() feature types}.
127     *
128     * @return names of the feature types.
129     *
130     * @deprecated As of ISO 19115:2014, replaced by {@link #getFeatureTypeInfo()}.
131     */
132    @Deprecated(since="3.1")
133    default Collection<? extends GenericName> getFeatureTypes() {
134        final ArrayList<GenericName> names = new ArrayList<>();
135        getFeatureTypeInfo().forEach((info) -> names.add(info.getFeatureTypeName()));
136        return names;
137    }
138
139    /**
140     * Complete bibliographic reference to one or more external feature catalogues.
141     *
142     * @condition Mandatory if the feature catalogue is not included with resource
143     * and {@code FeatureCatalogue} is not provided.
144     *
145     * @return bibliographic reference to one or more external feature catalogues.
146     */
147    @UML(identifier="featureCatalogueCitation", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19115)
148    Collection<? extends Citation> getFeatureCatalogueCitations();
149}
